text.content: _________________________________________________ Details: ♥ Female, 10 months old, Irish Wolfhound + Border Collie mix.
She has a rough medium length coat (black and white).
♥ Kayla is under foster care as her family had to travel overseas due to unforeseen circumstances.
Kayla is now seeking a permanent new family.
_________________________________________________ Character: ♥ Kayla is an intelligent and high energy dog.
She loves taking walks (especially running around fields, beaches, hiking, etc).
If you're an active person, she will happily tag along on a leash as you do your daily runs/cycling/etc. :)
♥ DESPITE her energy; Kayla is a VERY calm dog when indoors!
She will only get onto beds/sofas if invited and otherwise makes herself comfy where she can.
♥ Kayla understands a few commands like "sit", "stay" and "shake".
She was also trained to wait for her food and walk off leash by her previous owners (however I have not followed up on this during the period of foster care).
♥ She has an amazing temperament too!
Gets along well with dogs (cats also if she sees them indoors/as part of the family.
Kayla is especially patient and loving around children, She's the type of dog that would lie in bed with the kids and keep them feeling safe/protected.
♥ Kayla requires NO grooming whatsoever as her fur stays the length it already is.
She also hardly "smells" and only needs a bath once a month at most if indoors (unless she's really had a muddy run somewhere or rolled where she shouldn't).
She will half-sit in a pool, even chase after water sprinkling out of a hose. :)
♥ Potty habits; When indoors, Kayla will bark 3 - 4 times in a row to let her people know she needs to be let out to do her business.
She appreciates routine daily walks (at least once in the morning, another in the evening before bedtime).
♥ Kayla is fully vaccinated (rabies shots included).
She is also spayed, parasite free and micro-chipped.
She is not fussy about food either.
_________________________________________________ *** PLEASE READ (Note for potential adopters) *** ♥ Kayla takes time to adjust to new people (at least 2 weeks to trust).
She will bond closely to anyone who pays the most attention to her.
She will accept "firm" tones when being trained but NO rough tones/scolding of any kind.
♥ Kayla likes being indoors % EXCEPT when she needs to be taken out for some form of activity.
♥ Kayla needs round the clock attention (she will get anxious if left crated any longer than 4 hours a day).
Adopters with lots of time on their hands are her best preference.
♥ An adoption fee will apply to cover Kayla's basic care (please inquire).
Her cards will be passed to successful adopters. :)
_________________________________________________ Please drop me a call or email if interested in taking this girl home.
Details on your past experience with dogs will be much appreciated.
